text: Jarvis Allen Johnson (born ) is an American model, YouTuber, and former software engineer. He has been running his YouTube channel since October 12, 2006. == Education == Johnson was born on May 5, 1992. From 2006 until 2010, he was taught at Eastside High School in Gainesville, Florida. He graduated with an International Baccalaureate diploma. He then went on to the Georgia Institute of Technology in 2010. He studied computer science there. He graduated with a bachelor of science high honors degree in 2014. He has worked for the Georgia Institute of Technology, Radiant Systems, Google, Yelp, and Patreon. == Early works == Before creating his YouTube channel on October 12, 2006, Johnson worked in other places. He worked as a student assistant, and then a teaching assistant at the Georgia Institute of Technology, a software developer intern at Radiant Systems, an engineering practicum intern at Google, a software engineer intern, and then a software engineer at Yelp, and a senior software engineer, and then an engineering manager at Patreon. ==Career== Johnson's channel has many different commentaries and running jokes, such as "Zeffo Overlord of 1-2-3 Go", and how "comically large" his computer science degree is. His channel also serves content farms and their ability to game the YouTube algorithms, giving attention to their media content, that can be seen to encourage behavior, whether regarding animated story channels based on untrue accounts or unproductive, or even dangerous, life hacks, popularized by the 5-Minute Crafts and Bright Side channels, which are managed by TheSoul Publishing. ==Reputation== In August 2018, traffic to Johnson's channel increased when another YouTuber, called Cody Ko, uploaded a video about 5-Minute Crafts, a topic that Johnson had already spoken about. Ko indirectly helped Johnson gain more recognition. Johnson was listed as one of Forbes "30 under 30" list of influential people of 2021. In May 2021, Johnson posted a video on Twitter captioned "what a normal and ultimate spaghetti hack!" The video had a woman pouring Prego sauce onto a kitchen counter. The tweet gained international recognition and Prego ended up on the trending page on Twitter. The video in the tweet was then taken down by the creator of the video a mere 2 days later. ==Ownership stake== In July 2021, Rhett and Link announced that their production company, Mythical Entertainment, had got an ownership stake in the umbrella company Johnson founded for his various revenue streams. == Awards and nominations == Year Award Category Result 2020 11th Shorty Awards YouTube Commentary 10th Streamy Awards Commentary 2021 11th Streamy Awards Commentary == Notes == == References == Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:American YouTubers Category:American software engineers
title: Jarvis Johnson (YouTuber)
